intro: Barbarea vulgaris var. gracilis, commonly known as slender winter cress, is a low-growing annual plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically reaches a height of 10–30 centimeters and features small, alternate leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which are followed by heart-shaped, lobed seed pods. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in fields, along roadsides, and in gardens. Due to its rapid growth and ability to spread through self-seeding, it can become invasive in certain environments.
